tool_description: Words API lets you retrieve information about English words, including definitions, synonyms, rhymes, pronunciation, syllables, and frequency of usage. It also can tell you about relationships between words, for instance that "math" has categories like "algebra" and "geometry", or that a "finger" is part of a "hand".
name: WordsAPI
title: WordsAPI

api_list.name: Synonyms
api_list.description: Get synonyms of a word
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com/words/lovely/synonyms"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com/words/{word}/synonyms"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Word
api_list.description: Retrieve information about a word. Results can include definitions, part of speech, synonyms, related words, syllables, and pronunciation. This method is useful to see which relationships are attached to which definition and part of speech of a word.

api_list.name: Definitions
api_list.description: Get definitions of a word, including the part of speech.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com/words/incredible/definitions"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com/words/{word}/definitions"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Examples
api_list.description: Get examples of how the word is used.

api_list.name: Rhymes
api_list.description: Get a list of words that rhyme with the given word.

api_list.name: Is a Type Of

api_list.name: Antonyms
api_list.description: Get antonyms (opposites) of a word.

api_list.name: Has Types
api_list.description: Get more specific examples of types of this word.

api_list.name: Pronunciation
api_list.description: How to pronounce a word, according to the International Phonetic Alphabet. May include multiple results if the word is pronounced differently depending on its part of speech.

required_parameters.name: word
required_parameters.description: Try "wind". It sounds different depending on if its a noun or a verb.

api_list.code:

api_list.name: Frequency
api_list.description: Expands upon the frequeny score returned by the main /words/{word} endpoint.  Returns zipf, a score indicating how common the word is in the English language, with a range of 1 to 7; perMillion, the number of times the word is likely to appear in a corpus of one million English words; and diversity, a 0-1 scale the shows the likelyhood of the word appearing in an English document that is part of a corpus.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com/words/apartment/frequency"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Random
api_list.description: Retrieve a random word, optionally matching a search criteria. You can use the same search criteria as the "Search" endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com/words/?random=true"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com/words/?random=true"

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "wordsapiv1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search
api_list.description: Search for words matching the parameters you provide.  For more examples, please see the documentation on the website.  https://www.wordsapi.com/docs#search

optional_parameters.name: pronunciationpattern
optional_parameters.description: Find words whose pronunciation matches the regular expression.

optional_parameters.name: soundsmax
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of phonemes (sounds) the word can have.

optional_parameters.name: sounds
optional_parameters.description: The number of phonemes (sounds) the word mush have.

optional_parameters.name: soundsMin
optional_parameters.description: The minimum number of phonemes (sounds) the word can have.

optional_parameters.name: syllablesMax
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of syllables the word can have.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of results to return per page. Must be between 1 and 100. Default is 100.

optional_parameters.name: frequencymin
optional_parameters.description: The minimum frequency score of words to return. You can use this to limit your search to words that people are familiar with (like "go", with a frequency of 6.98). The range is from 1.74 - 8.03.

optional_parameters.name: letterPattern
optional_parameters.description: Find words whose letters match the regular expression.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The page of results to return. The default is page 1.

optional_parameters.name: partofspeech
optional_parameters.description: The matching word must have at least one definition with this part of speech.

optional_parameters.name: lettersmin
optional_parameters.description: The minimum number of letters the word must have.

optional_parameters.name: letters
optional_parameters.description: The number of letters the word must have.

optional_parameters.name: lettersMax
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of letters the word can have.

optional_parameters.name: syllablesMin
optional_parameters.description: The minimum number of syllables the word can have.

optional_parameters.name: syllables
optional_parameters.description: The number of syllables the word must have.

optional_parameters.name: frequencymax
optional_parameters.description: The maximum frequency score of words to return. You can use this to limit your search to words that aren't seen as frequently (like "zygote", with a frequency of 2.55). The range is from 1.74 - 8.03.

optional_parameters.name: hasDetails
optional_parameters.description: A comma delimited list of detail types the word has. For instance, to find words that have both "typeOf" and "hasCategories" relationship, you would send "hasDetails=typeOf,hasCategories".
